page.title: 18Interview with a pilot
page.content: We talked to a Lieutenant who flies with one of{10 squadrons at H.} {M.S.Heron(Base) the H.Q. of the Fleet {Air Arm at Yeovilton.}Cadet pilots are also trained here. The training lasts 6 years and includes working for 'A' level exams and a year at Dartford. { Marines}are also stationed on the Base for part of their training. Pilots actually fly for about 8 hours a week.Night flying is not much liked!{Local hazards}to flying include bad weather,Glastonbury Tor and flocks of birds.Hawks are kept at the Base to keep the runways clear of birds at take-off and landing. A{Sea Harrier}pilot can fly at 650 knots and reach a height of 7 miles! Other planes at the Base are{Hunters, {Canberra, Heron, Chipmunk, Falcon, Sea {King, Wessex, Gazelle and Lynx.
